On Monday 19 July 2004 15:36, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Chris Dollin wrote:
>  > Usually I run the tests for
> >
> > the bit I'm tinkering with at a moments provocation and run the full
> > suite when I reach some kind of anchor point - the necessity for loading
> > or unloading tea, the final new feature working, or Oh My Stars Has It
> > Been An Hour?!
>
> This seems to be a common pattern. I recommend adding the repeated
> automated build (like CruiseControl), as a way of eliminating the
> possibility of not running all the tests for an hour.

If I'd had a problem with this, then I'd consider that as a solution - but I
haven't, so it stays as background knowledge.

Nothing gets *checked in* without me running the full suite. Usually I
do an update first, as well, just in case any colleagues have done things
that yank the carpet out from under my code - although it must be said
that I'm more likely to be the carpet-yanker.

-- 
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
